alert.note: Alert for West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 04 at 4:37AM CDT until April 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 16 inches with locally higher snowfall totals. . Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast North Dakota. * WHEN...From noon today to 7 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard force winds will not occur during the entire time frame. However, whiteout conditions due to heavy falling snow may.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
